Indian officials have announced plans to place 50,000 troops on the northern border with China. The move could cost $11 billion over seven years. The BBC's Rahul Tandon joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio from Calcutta with the details.

description: Indian officials have announced plans to place 50,000 troops on the northern border with China. The move could cost $11 billion over seven years.
teaser: Indian officials have announced plans to place 50,000 troops on the northern border with China. The move could cost $11 billion over seven years.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, July 18, 2013
contentencoded: Indian officials have announced plans to place 50,000 troops on the northern border with China. The move could cost $11 billion over seven years. The BBC's Rahul Tandon joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio from Calcutta with the details.
title: India's economic rivalry with China gets political
